alert.note: Alert for Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:59PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Van Buren and northern Scotland Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 259 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cantril to near Milton to near Downing. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could break small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Memphis, Cantril, Granger, Crawford, Arbela, Mount Sterling, Hitt, Memphis Memorial Airport, Kilwinning, Brock, Prospect Grove, Scotland County Fairgrounds and Azen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
